column4: I'm trying to delete a directory but ubuntu keeps telling me its not empty, despite the fact that there are no files in it. From the CLI i do an "ls -aR" and it lists sub directories, but also "Input/output error". Any fix?
type this ' cd && mv path-to-folder path-to-folder-new && sudo rm -rf path-to-folder '
what i mean is, make sure you're not in the directory you're deleting, rename folder, then remove the folder
try to rename the folder and then delete?
no go, renaming it didint work either
its a seperate logical partition, formatted as ntfs and mounted to my home directory
another user mention you should try to unmount the partition.  Check what Loshki said
Loshki but if i unmount how do I delete/access it?
Loshki ok, this is messed but i just managed to delete it now... all gone.. success i guess and ty for the help!
in nautilus, move to trash.. the easiest way :)
it was a mozilla cache directory backed up from my winbox... could have been windows locking it for a set period.. i fuess?
Don't know, just glad you solved it ;D
